com.jalapeno
Interface ObjectManagerFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
ApplicationContext
public interface ObjectManagerFactory

API for creating and managing connections to the database.

Provides 3 mutually exlusive options to create instances of ObjectManager:

  • By using URL, username a and password to connect to the database.
  • By using java.util.Properties to connect to the database. Properties should contain all necessary information for creating a connection, such as URL, username and password. They can also contain additional connection options.
  • By using a predefined Datasource for obtaining low-level connections to database, e.g. JDBC connections. Datasource can implement connection pooling, security and other special features.

All above options first obtain low-level connection such as JDBC java.sql.Connection and then create ObjectManager on top of it. Low level connections are not normally pooled or reused be ObjectManagerFactory itself however such functionality may be provided by Datasource.

Implementing class must also provide a static method to create an instance of ObjectManager for a given low-level connection.

defaultSettings

Settings defaultSettings()
Provides interface to define application-wide settings for ObjectManagers. Settings include Fetch Policy, Client Cache Type, default ClassLoader.

Settings also can be configured for individual ObjectManager instances.

Returns:
an instance of Settings used by this ObjectManagerFactory
See Also:
ObjectManager.settings()
